**Government Tender Announcement**
---------------------------

### Request for Proposal (RFP) #30003215

### Solicitation Title
#### Permanent Elimination of the Threat of Pollution Posed by the Vessel MV Caruso

### Overview
Pêches et Océans Canada/Garde côtière canadienne seeks proposals from qualified suppliers for the permanent elimination of the threat of pollution posed by the vessel MV Caruso. The scope of work includes the removal of recoverable pollutants from the vessel, site preparation for vessel dismantling, final disposal of the vessel and its contents at recognized recycling facilities, and remediation of the worksite.

### Proposal Guidelines

*   *Bidder Qualifications*: Suppliers must have experience in hazardous waste disposal, diving, and salvage services.
*   *Language*: Proposals must be submitted in either official language (English or French).
*   *Security Clearance*: This procurement does not require security clearance.
*   *Documentation*: Suppliers are advised that "buyandsell.gc.ca" is not responsible for distributing solicitation documents.

### Proposal Information

*   *Objective*: The Canadian Coast Guard requires the permanent elimination of the threat of pollution posed by the vessel MV Caruso.
*   *Scope of Work*: The scope of work includes the removal of recoverable pollutants from the vessel, site preparation for vessel dismantling, final disposal of the vessel and its contents at recognized recycling facilities, and remediation of the worksite.
*   *Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement*: This procurement is not subject to any comprehensive land claims agreements.
*   *Period of Contract*: The period of contract shall be from date of award to February 13, 2023.
*   *Contract Authority*: Olivier Trinh, Contracting Authority Name, Phone Number: 873-455-0475, Email Address: DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca

### Requirements and Evaluation Criteria
The RFP will be evaluated based on the following criteria:

*   *Experience*: Supplier experience in hazardous waste disposal, diving, and salvage services.
*   *Ability to Meet the Scope of Work*: Supplier's ability to meet the requirements outlined in the scope of work.
*   *Technical Approach*: Supplier's technical approach to completing the scope of work.

### Statistical Requirements

*   *Dates*: Tender Closing Date, October 11, 2022, 2:00 PM ET.
*   *Location*: Fisheries and Oceans Canada, 200 Kent St, Station 13E
